words.definition: (of something bad) experienced or present to the maximum degree
words.fillInBlank: Timmy was _____ after falling off the jungle gym and into the lava

words.definition: a departure from what is normal, usual, or expected, typically one that is unwelcome
words.fillInBlank: It wasn't an ________ they really were making her pull her hair out

words.definition: solemnly renounce (a belief, cause, or claim)
words.fillInBlank: After months of late-night cheese binges, she decided to ______ all dairy, embracing the concept of salads and reluctantly turning her back on extra-mature cheddar.

words.definition: renounce or reject (something desired or valuable)
words.fillInBlank: The monk chose to _______ worldly pleasures, seeking enlightenment through meditation and a surprisingly competitive board game collection.

words.definition: repeal or do away with (a law, right, or formal agreement)
words.fillInBlank: The band was ______ from the hotel after an unfortunate incident involving a flock of pigeons, a confetti cannon, and some questionable room service choices.

words.definition: leave hurriedly and secretly, typically to avoid detection of or arrest for an unlawful action
words.fillInBlank: Seeking sun over spreadsheets, the overworked employee simply _______, leaving behind nothing but a lingering whiff of rebellion.

words.definition: difficult to understand; obscure
words.fillInBlank: He stared at her blankly as if the words were ______.

words.definition: assent or agree to a demand, request, or treaty
words.fillInBlank: Later, in the ditch, he ______ they did have the right of way

words.definition: approach and address (someone) boldly or aggressively
words.fillInBlank: The charity worker tried to _____  passersby on the street for donations, but after the third failed attempt, had to revise her strategy to involve less eye contact and a faster walking pace.

words.definition: the growth or increase of something by the gradual accumulation of additional layers or matter
words.fillInBlank: The coral reef grows slowly due to the ______ of tiny marine organisms, a process that makes for a surprisingly soothing nature documentary but somewhat less exciting live-action adventure.

words.definition: the ability to make good judgments and quick decisions
words.fillInBlank: The seasoned detective possessed remarkable _____ , solving complex cases with an unnerving speed that involved crumpled newspapers, an old magnifying glass, and a collection of half-eaten donuts.

words.definition: refusing to be persuaded or to change one's mind
words.fillInBlank: The toddler stood with ______ resolve, arms crossed, refusing to eat broccoli even when it was disguised as a tiny tree, a landing pad for superheroes, or a dinosaur snack.

words.definition: warn or reprimand someone firmly
words.fillInBlank: After repeatedly misplacing her keys, the teacher had to ______ herself, developing an elaborate system of brightly colored keychains, jangling bracelets, and increasingly frantic morning searches.

words.definition: represent in outline or in a suggestive way
words.fillInBlank: The artist's sketch seemed to ______  the deeper emotions of the subject, hinting at a hidden sorrow with a few skillfully drawn lines and a strategically placed shadow.

words.definition: preventing success or development; harmful; unfavorable
words.fillInBlank: The storm created ______ sailing conditions for the small boat, which bravely endured waves the size of small mountains and a distinct feeling among the crew that they should have just stayed home.

words.definition: a person who publicly supports or recommends a particular cause or policy
words.fillInBlank: She became a passionate _____ for animal rights, fiercely determined to make a difference, one rescued hedgehog and indignantly protesting squirrel at a time.

words.definition: having a great deal of money or wealth
words.fillInBlank: The ______ neighborhood was filled with sprawling mansions, suspiciously well-groomed poodles, and a distinct lack of anyone willing to admit to ever having eaten instant noodles.

words.definition: increase the power, status, or wealth of (someone or something)
words.fillInBlank: The power-hungry politician sought to ______ his own reputation with lengthy speeches, questionable statues, and a rather impressive collection of hats.

words.definition: brisk and cheerful readiness
words.fillInBlank: The enthusiastic puppy greeted his returning owner with remarkable ______, bouncing around the room with enough energy to power a small village and a rather slobbery tennis ball.

words.definition: a false or assumed name
words.fillInBlank: The master of disguise slipped into the party under the ______  of a cheese enthusiast with a questionable accent and a suspiciously large wheel of brie.

words.definition: having or showing mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something or someone
words.fillInBlank: The student felt strangely ______  about the final exam, a mix of quiet confidence and the lingering suspicion that she might have forgotten what a "noun" was.

words.definition: open and responsive to suggestion; easily persuaded or controlled
words.fillInBlank: The notoriously stubborn toddler proved surprisingly ______ when bribed with the promise of extra ice cream and a new episode of his favorite cartoon involving talking dinosaurs.

words.definition: without a clearly defined shape or form
words.fillInBlank: The swirling fog had an ______ shape, shifting and changing form in a way that was either hauntingly beautiful or a great way to make someone accidentally walk into a tree.

words.definition: belonging to a period other than that being portrayed
words.fillInBlank: The knight in shining armor charging into battle on a segway seemed somewhat ______ , leading to confused looks from the dragon and a hasty rewriting of the history books.

words.definition: based on random choice or personal whim, rather than any reason or system
words.fillInBlank: The art critic's choices seemed entirely ______, declaring a piece of crumpled paper a masterpiece and dismissing an actual sculpture as "too representational of reality."

words.definition: of, relating to, or living in trees
words.fillInBlank: Those squirrels, with their bushy tails and love of heights, were clearly ______ creatures.

words.definition: understood by few; mysterious or secret
words.fillInBlank: The ancient spell was shrouded in ______ language, its meaning decipherable only by those with a fondness for dusty books, questionable potions, and long naps.

words.definition: very typical of a certain kind of person or thing
words.fillInBlank: The detective story featured the ______ cast of characters: the gruff detective, the suspicious butler, and the enigmatic femme fatale with a tragic past and a collection of deadly hatpins.

words.definition: to take or claim (something) without justification
words.fillInBlank: The power-hungry villain sought to ______ control of the kingdom, based mainly on his impressive cape collection and rather loud declarations of his own brilliance.

words.definition: characterized by severe self-discipline and abstention from all forms of indulgence
words.fillInBlank: The ______ monk lived in a tiny hut, subsisting on a diet of water, contemplation, and the occasional stale rice cracker.

words.definition: an attack on the reputation or integrity of someone or something
words.fillInBlank: The rival scientists hurled ______ at each other, disputing everything from the existence of invisible sheep to the optimal temperature for brewing tea.

words.definition: showing great care and perseverance
words.fillInBlank: The ______ student meticulously copied out her notes, color-coded her flashcards, and practiced her exam answers in front of a slightly bewildered cat.

words.definition: something or someone that one vehemently dislikes
words.fillInBlank: To the rebellious teenager, chores and the mere concept of mornings were an absolute ______, to be avoided at all costs.

words.definition: to add a territory or space (typically by force)
words.fillInBlank: The ambitious emperor planned to ______  the neighboring island, motivated by dreams of expanding his beach towel collection and building an empire of questionable sandcastles.

words.definition: of or belonging to the period before the biblical flood
words.fillInBlank: The museum's fossil collection included the ______ remains of a dinosaur with a particularly grumpy expression and an unfortunate fondness for eating ferns.

words.definition: substances that act against infection by inhibiting the growth of microorganisms
words.fillInBlank: With its potent smell and suspicious ability to make even the tiniest paper cut sting, the old-fashioned ______ did its job, though perhaps with excessive enthusiasm.

words.definition: showing or feeling no interest, enthusiasm, or concern
words.fillInBlank: The ______ audience stared blankly at the comedian, who began to suspect his elaborate mime routine about the perils of mismatched socks might not be as funny as he'd imagined.

words.definition: a person or thing that is the direct opposite of someone or something else
words.fillInBlank: In a world obsessed with speed and instant gratification, the slow-moving sloth was the ______ of modern life, proving the enduring appeal of naps and a relaxed philosophy.

words.definition: (of a story or statement) of doubtful authenticity, although widely circulated as being true
words.fillInBlank: The internet was filled with ______ stories involving celebrity encounters with aliens and surprisingly well-spoken pigeons with a fondness for conspiracy theories.

words.definition: approval or praise
words.fillInBlank: Earning the dreaded "Most Improved Handwriting" award did little to raise the student's spirits, as he considered it rather faint ______ considering his previous penmanship resembled spiderwebs dipped in ink.
